message.content:
cs.SI, cs.IR, cs.SOC, cs.CL, cs.CY 

This paper deals with mining topical experts on social media, which involves analyzing large amounts of data from multiple sources such as message text, user lists, webpages, social graphs, and Wikipedia. This suggests that the paper could belong to several sub-categories, including Social and Information Networks (cs.SI), Information Retrieval (cs.IR), Social and Behavioral Sciences (cs.SOC), Computational Linguistics (cs.CL), and Cybersecurity (cs.CY). However, given the focus on social media and social networks, cs.SI and cs.IR are the most likely sub-categories.
